09:56 <@sdumitriu> Can you explain http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering-3.0/20/consoleText ?  
09:57 <@sdumitriu> It's not possible not to find xwiki-commons-41  
09:58 <@sdumitriu> It's the parent project, how can it not find it only during the Standalone Distribution module?

17:13 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <+jvelociter> hi cjdelisle  
17:14 <+jvelociter> I have the following error starting my wiki : http://pastebin.com/UfQYbeuk  
17:15 <+jvelociter> could it be related to your latest commits ?  
17:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
17:48 <+jvelociter> cjdelisle: if I revert your last two commits it's much better :O  
17:59 <@cjdelisle> ahh sorry about that  
18:05 <@cjdelisle> The only copy I have is pretty heavily modded, I was a bit lazy and assumed that if the integration tests passed, everything was fine.  
18:05 <@cjdelisle> I'll install a vanilla wiki and see what I did  
18:18 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <vmassol> guys several ui tests are failing because of delete/rollback (ie storgage) issues  
18:22 <vmassol> for ex I got the following in the import test locally:  
18:22 <vmassol>     Error number 3233 in 3: Exception while deleting attachment Main.TestPage-backup.xar of document XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
18:22 <vmassol> Wrapped Exception: Failed to commit or rollback transaction. Root cause []  
18:22 <vmassol> com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3233 in 3: Exception while deleting attachment Main.TestPage-backup.xar of document XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
18:22 <vmassol> Wrapped Exception: Failed to commit or rollback transaction. Root cause []  
18:22 <vmassol> Wrapped Exception:  
18:22 <vmassol> org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Could not execute JDBC batch update  
18:22 <vmassol> Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: failed batch  
18:22 <vmassol> sdumitriu: any idea about what could cause this (I started to see this about a week ago)?  
18:23 <vmassol> it doesn't happen all the time but frequently  
18:23 <vmassol> maybe it's related to the hibernate upgrade  
18:23 <vmassol> (I say one week but it could have happened before)  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> Got a full stacktrace?  
18:27 <vmassol> yes  
18:28 <vmassol> http://pastebin.com/eTPL2D5r  
18:34 <vmassol> we also get this one which I think is related: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/851/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.administration/ImportTest/testImportWithNewHistoryVersion/  
18:34 <vmassol> same for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/851/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.scheduler/SchedulerTest/testJobActions/  
18:34 <vmassol> basically apart from the defaultAnnotationTest all other tests seem to be related to delete/rollback failures  
18:34 <vmassol> (they seem to be real issues and not issues of the tests)  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> Hm, no idea  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> Usually there's a meaningful message sent from mysql  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> But hsqldb doesn't seem to be so explicit  
18:37 <+sburjan`> can someone tell me a component we have on platform ? maybe even with a github link to it  
18:38 <vmassol> !search xwiki component  
18:40 <vmassol> thought we had some examples somewhere in the doc….  
18:40 <vmassol> basically  
18:40 <+sburjan`> I am unable to find  
18:40 <vmassol> you can search for any java class that has @Component  
18:40 <+sburjan`> I wanted to see the source code ... to see if the tutorial is up to date  
18:40 <+sburjan`> too bad search on github kinda sucks  
18:42 <vmassol> indeed it seems to suck....  
18:43 <vmassol> I tried repo:xwiki-commons "@Component"  
18:43 <vmassol> https://github.com/search?type=Repositories&language=&q=repo%3Axwiki-commons+%22%40Component%22&repo=&langOverride=&x=17&y=12&start\_value=1  
18:43 <vmassol> (see https://github.com/search)  
18:43 <vmassol> but not working for me  
18:44 <+sburjan`> I will look forther thanks :)  
18:49 <sburjan`> has quit  
18:49 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
18:50 <vmassol> has quit  
18:52 <@cjdelisle>  \* @deprecated starting with 3.1M2 use SLF4J instead  
18:52 <@cjdelisle> Is there an example of the SLF4J logger being dependency injected somewhere?
